{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3377145,"name":"Richard Watson","username":"Valin6210","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/valin6210/{size}/226065_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-30T11:50:08.194Z","cooked":"

Greetings,

We’re starting out with Photonvision. We purchased 4 Orange Pi 5s and the Arducams (one color, 3 B&W). We’re running the same SW release on all of them. Three of the setups connect as expected, one Orange Pi does not. We’ve hooked it up to a monitor and verified it’s booting and getting an IP address. We can ping it from the host PC, etc.

Anything else to check before we return this Orange Pi as defective and get a new one?

Cheers…

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-04-30T11:50:08.194Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":75,"reads":105,"readers_count":104,"score":411.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":464957,"topic_slug":"photonvision-not-connecting-on-an-orange-pi-5","display_username":"Richard Watson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66449,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/photonvision-not-connecting-on-an-orange-pi-5/464957/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3377148,"name":"Anderson Hall","username":"Xactlysharp","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/xactlysharp/{size}/186572_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-30T11:58:10.327Z","cooked":"

I’d just run through some normal troubleshooting steps:

  • Are the opi(s) the same model? Check the boards
  • Do you have the same firmware on all of them?
  • Are they powered and networked exactly the same?
  • Inspect the board for any visible damage
  • Try a different SD card
  • Try different power/ethernet
  • Re-format the SD card and put a new download of PV on it

The fact that it boots but not with PV makes me think it’s a firmware issue on the SD card

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-04-30T11:58:10.327Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":97,"readers_count":96,"score":49.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":464957,"topic_slug":"photonvision-not-connecting-on-an-orange-pi-5","display_username":"Anderson Hall","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55065,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8088 Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/photonvision-not-connecting-on-an-orange-pi-5/464957/2","custom_user_title":"8088 Alumni","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3377150,"name":"Richard Watson","username":"Valin6210","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/valin6210/{size}/226065_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-30T12:13:35.087Z","cooked":"

Yes, all are the same model.

They are all running the same FW, we flashed 5 SD-cards and have tested SD-cards from the boards that do connect to PV in the bad board, the bad board won’t connect.

The physical setup (power/ethernet) works for the other 3 OPis so it’s not a physical layer issue. Though, yes, we have tried other network and power setups.

I can’t think of any other troubleshooting steps…
Best bet now is to try anything else you can think of or return the opi
